edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models
Class Vertex

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.ObservableModel
          edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.Vertex

public class Vertex
extends ObservableModel

The Vertex class represents one of the two fundamental mathematical elements in a graph along with edges. When used together with edges, vertices can be related to each other to form a graph.

As an ObservableModel, this class supports multiple subscribing Observers. Whenever a change is made to any of its properties, notification of that change is automatically propagated upwards until it hits the Graph level and triggers a Observable.notifyObservers(Object) call.

Author:
Cameron Behar
See Also:
Graph}, {@link Vertex}, {@link Edge}

Method Detail

getPoint2D

public java.awt.geom.Point2D getPoint2D()

Returns:

isIncident

public boolean isIncident(Edge edge)
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the specified Edge is adjacent to this Vertex. A vertex is said to be incident to an edge if and only if the edge goes from- or to- the vertex.

Parameters:
edge - the Edge to which to this vertex for incidence
Returns:
true if the specified Edge is incident to this Vertex, false otherwise

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this vertex in JSON format. This method can be used to serialize a vertex, which may later be deserialized using the class's string constructor. For more information on the JSON format (used throughout VisiGraph for serialization), visit here.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
this Vertex serialized as a String
See Also:
